import Mathlib

variable {E : Type*} [InnerProductSpace ‚Ñù E]

/-- Suppose B : E ‚ÜíL[‚Ñù] ‚Ñù is given by B x = inner b x for some b : E. Then the operator norm of B
    equals the norm of b. -/
theorem opNorm_inner_left (b : E) (B : ContinuousLinearMap ‚Ñù E ‚Ñù) (h : ‚àÄ x, B x = Inner.inner ‚Ñù b x) :
  ‚ÄñB‚Äñ = ‚Äñb‚Äñ := by sorry

args.content:
import Mathlib

variable {E : Type*} [InnerProductSpace ‚Ñù E]

/-- Suppose B : E ‚ÜíL[‚Ñù] ‚Ñù is given by B x = inner b x for some b : E. Then the operator norm of B
    equals the norm of b. -/
theorem opNorm_inner_left (b : E) (B : ContinuousLinearMap (RingHom.id ‚Ñù) E ‚Ñù)
  (h : ‚àÄ x, B x = Inner.inner ‚Ñù b x) : ‚ÄñB‚Äñ = ‚Äñb‚Äñ := by sorry

args.content:
import Mathlib

variable {E : Type*} [InnerProductSpace ‚Ñù E]

/-- For b : E, the continuous linear functional `innerSL ‚Ñù b : E ‚ÜíL[‚Ñù] ‚Ñù` has operator norm equal to
    the norm of b. -/
theorem operator_norm_innerSL (b : E) : ‚Äñ(innerSL ‚Ñù b : E ‚ÜíL[‚Ñù] ‚Ñù)‚Äñ = ‚Äñb‚Äñ := by sorry

result: {"ok": true, "results": [{"nl": "For any seminormed abelian group \\(E\\), normed space \\(\\mathbb{R} E\\), vector \\(u \\in E\\), scalars \\(a, b \\in \\mathbb{R}\\) such that \\(0 \\leq a\\), \\(0 \\leq b\\), and \\(a \\geq b\\), if \\(a \\cdot u\\) and \\(b \\cdot u\\) are on the same ray in \\(\\mathbb{R} E\\), then show that the norm of the difference \\(a \\cdot u - b \\cdot u\\) is equal to the absolute difference of their norms, i.e., \\(\\|a \\cdot u - b \\cdot u\\| = |\\|a \\cdot u\\|

args.content:
import Mathlib

variable {E : Type*} [NormedAddCommGroup E] [InnerProductSpace ‚Ñù E]

/-- For b : E, the continuous linear functional `innerSL ‚Ñù b : E ‚ÜíL[‚Ñù] ‚Ñù` has operator norm equal to
    the norm of b. -/
theorem operator_norm_innerSL (b : E) : ‚Äñ(innerSL ‚Ñù b : E ‚ÜíL[‚Ñù] ‚Ñù)‚Äñ = ‚Äñb‚Äñ := by sorry
